snippet: Emails show a growing preoccupation by Charles J. Hynes, the longtime district attorney, with his re-election as it became clear he would face a serious challenge.
abstract: Inquiry by New York City's Department of Investigation uncovers emails that illustrate how former Brooklyn District Atty Charles J Hynes came to be consumed by his efforts to be re-elected; Hynes, who is accused of misusing public funds and could face larceny charges, ran a campaign that grew desperate as it became clearer that his political career was about to end.

byline.original: By STEPHANIE CLIFFORD and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

lead_paragraph: Emails show a growing preoccupation by Charles J. Hynes, the longtime district attorney, with his re-election as it became clear he would face a serious challenge.

headline.main: Former Prosecutor in Brooklyn Was Consumed by Campaign, Emails Show
headline.print_headline: In Brooklyn Prosecutor’s Emails, Last Grasps at Election
